The provided code chunk is part of a Python script that configures a graphical user interface (GUI) using Tkinter, specifically within an environment page (`envPage`) of an application. The chunk sets up a frame containing buttons to toggle rendering styles: backface culling, lights, and texture. These buttons interact with the `ShowBaseGlobal` module's functions to control the rendering behavior of the application.

The code is part of a larger setup that includes various UI elements for adjusting parameters such as grid settings, undo/redo functionality, and render style toggles. The context suggests this chunk is used within an interactive 3D visualization or game development environment where users can modify rendering properties through a user-friendly interface.

drFrame.pack(fill = tk.BOTH, expand = 0)

        ## Render Style ##
        toggleFrame = tk.Frame(envPage, borderwidth = 2, relief = 'sunken')
        tk.Label(toggleFrame, text = 'Toggle Render Style',
                 font=('MSSansSerif', 14, 'bold')).pack(expand = 0)
        self.toggleBackfaceButton = tk.Button(
            toggleFrame,
            text = 'Backface',
            command = ShowBaseGlobal.base.toggleBackface)
        self.toggleBackfaceButton.pack(side = tk.LEFT, fill = tk.X, expand = 1)

        self.toggleLightsButton = tk.Button(
            toggleFrame,
            text = 'Lights',
            command = ShowBaseGlobal.direct.lights.toggle)
        self.toggleLightsButton.pack(side = tk.LEFT, fill = tk.X, expand = 1)

        self.toggleTextureButton = tk.Button(
            toggleFrame,
            text = 'Texture',
            command = ShowBaseGlobal.base.toggleTexture)
        self.toggleTextureButton.pack(side = tk.LEFT, fill = tk.X, expand = 1)
